text:
Q: create zip file in .net with password A:

WARNING:
DotNetZip is not longer maintained! If you're still looking for a solution, it looks like SharpZipLib or ProDotNetZip is a good alternative but I haven't used it myself.

Take a look at DotNetZip (@AFract supplied a new link to GitHub in the comments)

It has got pretty geat documentation and it also allow you to load the dll at runtime as an embeded file.

Q: Why does GCC emit different assembly here after specifying volatile (no flags/optimization)? A:

while(i != 0) ; has undefined behaviour, there's no way for i to change inside the loop making it an infinite loop with no side effects. The only way to break the loop is if i is modified by another thread, as that itself would be undefined behaviour, the compiler is free to generate whatever code it likes when compiling your code.

Q: JobRunr License Terms A:

Thanks for the reply and thanks for creating JobRunr! So the 100 recurring job limit has more to do with code limitations of the free version as opposed to it being a license term?

Q: How to get data from sub documents A:

Based on your question/comments and the structure given, check this,

db.collectionName.findOne({"players.firstName":"Bengt"},{"players.hiredBy":1})
